# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceed. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for i in 1:length(str)
        if (i - 1) % text_width == 0 && i > 1
            push!(lines, str[end - text_width + 1 : end])
            str = str[1:(end - text_width)]
        end
    end
    if length(str) > 0
        push!(lines, str)
    end
    return lines
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello there this is a very long string that should be wrapped into multiple lines")
6-element Vector{String}:
 "Hello there this is a"
 "very long string that"
 "should be wrapped into"
 "multiple lines"
```

If you want to specify the text width:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello there this is a very long string that should be wrapped into multiple lines", 20)
4-element Vector{String}:
 "Hello there this is a very"
 "long string that should be"
 "wrapped into multiple lines"
 ""
```
